generalInfo:
Forget just seeing Africa. Come and feel its ancient heartbeat. The Serengeti is not a park; it's a living, breathing organism of epic scale. Stand silent as a million hooves of the Great Migration thunder across endless golden plains—a primal spectacle of survival and motion found nowhere else on Earth. This is the stage for the greatest wildlife show our planet still performs.

Then, descend into Ngorongoro Crater, a lost world within a world. This UNESCO-protected Eden, a collapsed volcano cradling thousands of creatures, is Africa’s densest arena of life. Here, the Big Five roam in microcosm, a breathtaking snapshot of evolution in a self-contained paradise.

Shift your gaze upward in Tarangire National Park. Its landscape is defined by ancient, colossal baobabs—silent sentinels guarding timeless secrets. In the dry season, it becomes a theatre of giants, with massive herds of elephants converging on the life-giving Tarangire River, a scene of powerful, poignant gathering.

But this journey is more than wildlife. It’s connection. Walk in the villagel witness the real africa lifestyle,learn some kiswahili and some local language fron the natives. Share a mea (local cuisine)l and stories, gaining a profound window into a resilient culture. , join a cultural walk through a bustling market or a banana plantation, tasting local flavours and witnessing Tanzanian daily life.

This is the true call: to witness earth’s greatest spectacles and touch the enduring human spirit that tends them. It’s a pilgrimage to where life began, felt in the ground’s tremor and seen in a elder’s wise smile. Your place in the great story of our world awaits. Answer the call.

dayInfo.description: When you arrive at the Kilimanjaro International airport, you will be met by your safari driver guide who will drive you an hour to Arusha, where you will spend a peaceful night at Tumbili lodge, a well-deserved retreat after a long flight. Overnight – Tumbili Lodge (Bed & Breakfast Basis)

After your leisurely breakfast, our office representative and your safari guide will give a short orientation of the safari.Shortly after orientation starts your journey from Arusha to Tarangire National Park with a packed lunch for your first wildlife adventure. The drive to Tarangire takes about 2–2.5-hours. The park is home to a variety of wildlife and bird species; it hosts amazing elephant population density per square kilometre. Lunch in the park, after lunch spend a couple of hours driving in the park for wildlife sightings. Before dark drive to your lovely accommodation for overnight and meals. Dinner & overnight – Tarangire Safari Lodge (Full Board Basis)

Another day in wildlife paradise! Start your day with an early breakfast and then explore wildlife in the morning light of an African sunrise. The wild animals enjoy mornings and evenings due to cooler temperatures. During the afternoon it gets hot, wildlife gets less active, a typical behavior that helps them conserve their energy. You will get another chance to visit the park to see more fascinating wildlife sights. When you build up an appetite, you’ll have lunch in the park; after lunch, you’ll continue the game drive in the park for a couple of hours. Tarangire Park covers 2600 square kilometers and has one of the densest populations of elephants in the northern tourist circuit of the country. Dinner & overnight – Tarangire Safari Lodge (Full Board Basis)

After your leisurely breakfast, you’ll depart with a packed lunch and enjoy a game drive on the way to Lake Manyara Park. Along the way, you will stop at the Mto wa Mbu village, where you will spend an hour walking the village to learn of the local ways of life. After the village walk, you will continue the drive. Lake Manyara Park is smaller than the Tarangire and is quite different. Its habitat provides denser thickets since it has ground water forests like the rain forest. This kind of habitat is home to beautiful birds like Ross Turaco and Hartlaub’s Turaco, but you need to have an eagle eye to spot them. Flamingoes are abundant alongside an amazing variety of bird species. Don’t be surprised to see huge troops of baboons as the park has a large population. After lunch in the park, you will carry on with the game drive for a couple of hours. Dinner & overnight – Ang’ata Camp (Full Board basis)

Start your day with an early breakfast and leave with packed lunch for a game drive to the Ngorongoro crater. It will take about an hour to drive from the lodge to the crater floor. The area is great for its diversity of flora and fauna and is one of the few places left in the world that is home to the endangered black rhinoceros. Green season (wet season) is the best time to see the rhinoceros due to great pasture all over the park. They are more easily found than in the dry season, when good pasture is reduced. After lunch in the park, you will carry on with the game drive for a couple of hours. Dinner & overnight – Ang’ata Camp (Full Board Basis)

Your day starts after a leisurely breakfast. You will leave with a packed lunch for the Serengeti National Park. Driving across the Ngorongoro highland (not the crater) to the Serengeti Park takes 2–2.5-hours. Ndutu is an area where you will stay for two nights. This park lies between the Serengeti and the Ngorongoro Conservation Area. The vast migratory herd of wildlife settles here every year from November to late March due to greater pasture and habitat. Why is it greater pasture & habitat? Volcanic activities took place in Ngorongoro over a million years ago; the ashes were blown up to these areas and made the soil rich in essential minerals and fertility, making the pasture good and rich in protein. The habitat is an open plain, which is good for the wellbeing of wildebeests and zebra. Lunch in the park when you build up an appetite. After lunch, you will continue with a game drive for a couple of hours. Dinner & overnight – Ndutu Lodge (Full Board Basis)

Start your day early by taking a packed breakfast to explore the Southern Serengeti with the morning light, searching for the great migration. The great migration is a phenomenal sight, with a huge concentration of wildlife as far as your eyes can see. Predators venture out to look for food, as prey species are abundant almost everywhere. Breakfast in the bush when you build up an appetite. After breakfast you will continue with the game drive for a couple of hours. After lunch at the camp, take a siesta until late afternoon when the sun cools down. Leave again for the late afternoon drive for a couple of hours to enjoy the evening sightings of wildlife and sunset pictures over the Serengeti. Dinner & overnight – Ndutu Lodge

After your leisurely breakfast, drive to the Ndutu Airstrip for your flight back to Arusha. In Arusha, you will be picked up from the airport and driven to Tumbili Lodge for lunch and day use room. In the late evening, you will be transferred to Kilimanjaro International Airport for your flight home.
